meanings.definition: Shaking or trembling, especially due to old age or weakness.
meanings.sent1: The doddering old man struggled to walk steadily.
meanings.sent2: The nurse helped the doddering patient across the room.
meanings.sent3: The doddering cat tried to chase after a fast-moving squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The doddering tree swayed in the wind, its branches trembling.
meanings.sent5: The doddering bridge creaked under the weight of the heavy truck.

meanings.sent1: She doddering along the rocky path, trying to keep her balance.
meanings.sent2: The toddler doddering towards his mother with outstretched arms.
meanings.sent3: The penguin looked like it was doddering on the slippery ice.
meanings.sent4: The old car doddering down the bumpy road, rattling with each bump.
meanings.sent5: The leaf doddering in the breeze before finally falling to the ground.

meanings.definition: In a state of mental decline or confusion.
meanings.sent1: The doddering professor often forgot his own lectures.
meanings.sent2: The doddering patient struggled to remember even simple things.
meanings.sent3: The doddering robot kept mixing up its commands, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The doddering clock seemed to have lost track of time, chiming randomly.
meanings.sent5: The doddering computer screen flickered with a display of gibberish.
